results.title: Pasteur's experiments
results.creator_credit: Yasuaki Okada, Masaji Hara and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: A puppet film which shows the history of experiments dealing with the spontaneous generation of life. Demonstrates that microbes do not arise spontaneously from meat. Good for showing the experimental method.

results.title: Patrick [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Richard Franklin, Antony Ginnane and Australian International Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Patrick, having murdered his mother and her lover, has become a polyplegic, pre-oedipal, psychotic lump. He has telekinetic powers, fancies his nurse and is hostile to his doctor. This is an entertaining mix of black humour and suspense with a few shocks. Cast includes Susan Penhaligon, Robert Helpmann and Rod Mullinar.

results.title: Dial M for murder (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Alfred Hitchcock agreed to direct this masterful adaption of the broadway play by Frederick Knott merely to fulfil studio contractual obligations but “Dial M for murder” became one of his most acclaimed thrillers. Anxious to inherit his wife’s fortune, society playboy Tony Wendice (Ray Milland) ingeniously plots her murder. Blackmailing a former associate with a criminal record, he arranges what appears to be a perfect crime. However, his scheme is foiled when Margot (Grace Kelly) stabs her attacker with scissors. Wendice must now take his sinister web of intrigue in a different direction to cover his tracks. Co-starring John Williams.

results.title: Patricia's moving picture
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Kathleen Shannon, Ann Pearson, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Deals with the problems and frustration’s many women feel when they find that being a wife and mother at home does not fully occupy their time, and who do not find the stimulation they need to fulfil their lives and feel useful. Patricia wants to be “an individual” to be independent rather than the wife of Mr. Garner. (Awards: Melbourne, New York)

results.title: Paths of glory
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, James B. Harris, Bryna Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s World War One drama is a compelling anti-war film about the absurdities and horrors of war. Based on Humphrey Cobb’s novel, and co-written by Kubrick and Jim Thompson, ‘Paths of glory’ looks at the political machinations and power plays that ultimately decide who lives and dies in times of war, the cost and meaning of a life reduced to mere numbers and strategic manoeuvre. Set amongst the trenches and later on the decadent Chateau’s occupied by the French army’s elite, the films central courtroom drama focuses on the efforts of Colonel Dax (Kirk Douglas) to free three French soldiers (Joseph Turkel, Timothy Carey and Ralph Meeker) accused of cowardice for wisely retreating from a suicide mission to storm an Ant Hill occupied by the German army. Kubrick views the efforts of the French military to condemn these innocent men to death with detached bitter irony, leaving the films powerful message for it’s moving closing moments. Cast includes George Macready, Adolphe Menjou, Wayne Morris, Richard Anderson

results.title: Pat Whalan's world of floral art. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Building on skills demonstrated in Part 1, Pat shows how to create a Victorian Posy, the Florist’s Posy, a formal bouquet with handle and an informal Table Arrangement using oasis.

results.title: Pat Whalan's World of Floral Art. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Australian gardening and radio personality, Pat Whalan demonstrates the skill of the professional florist. Learn how to make buttonholes, posies and corsages using special wiring techniques.

results.title: Pat and Mike
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn are sparring partners in this punchy comedy, of two good sports who stage a never ending romantic battle. Katharine Hepburn plays “Pat”, an all-round woman athlete who is a whiz at golf, tennis, baseball, basketball, boxing, archery and Judo. Spencer Tracy superbly enacts the part of “Mike”, an unschooled, rough-mannered Broadway promoter who already has a racing horse, and a heavy-weight fighter (Aldo Ray) as “clients” and who, possessing the top horse is now determined to have the “top woman”.

results.title: Dick Hickey: blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Lorne Batchelor, Dave Bennett and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The blacksmith shop as a place for home-spun philosophy, where the village old-timers gather around the smithy stove to listen as the blacksmith, personified by Dick Hickey, goes about his work and shares his reflections about old times and the blacksmith’s craft.

results.title: Dick Deadeye or duty done
results.creator_credit: Bill Melendez, Steven Cuitlahuac Melendez and Bill Melendez Productions
results.brief_description: This animated jaunty rollick of music, comedy and quirky little characters is based on the orginal works of Gilbert and Sullivan (including some new lyrics by Robin Miller) and features the voices of Victor Spinetti, Peter Reeves, George A. Cooper, Miriam Karlin, John Newton.
